Imprint.Description:
The Empire, sometimes referred to as the Empire of Man, is an electoral monarchy composed of feudal states that is the largest and most important of the Human nations in the Old World. It was forged by the warrior-king and ascended deity Sigmar from the primitive tribes of Human barbarians who inhabited what became the lands of the southern Empire more than 2500 years ago.

Although not as skilled in craftsmanship as the Dwarfs or in magic as the High Elves, the people of the Empire are not beholden by the limits of tradition to the same extent as those elder races and continue to progress culturally, technologically and magically.

Having yet to succumb to any threat, external or internal, it is the faith, the sense of righteousness, and the unconquerable spirit of the realm's citizens which gives the Empire its strength, as well as the ruthless efficiency of its military and religious orders

Magic.Name: Lore of Fire
Magic.Options: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic
Magic.Enemy: Daemons of Chaos, The Lore of Nurgle

Weapon.Name: Runefang
Weapon.Description: All hits from a Runefang wound automatically and allow no armour saves

Weapon.Name: The Mace of Helsturm
Weapon.Description: The bearer can forfeit all of his normal Attacks to make only one Attack. Roll to hit normally. If this one Attack hits, the hit is resolved at Strength 10 and causes D6 wounds

Weapon.Name: Sword of Sigismund
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this sword strikes with +1 Strength and benefits from the 'always strikes first' special rule in close combat

Weapon.Name: Sword of Fate
Weapon.Rule: At the beginning of the battle, nominate one enemy character or monster. The sword counts as a magic sword with no particular bonuses against any other opponent, but attacks directed against the designated target will wound it on a 2+ and cause D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed

Weapon.Name: Sword of Power
Weapon.Description: The sword confers +2 Strength to all close combat attacks made by the character

Weapon.Name: Sword of Righteous Steel
Weapon.Description: The wielder always hits any opponent on a 2+, regardless of relative Weapon Skills. This cannot be modified in any way

Weapon.Name: Hammer of Judgement
Weapon.Description: Models hit by this hammer must take a Toughness test for every hit suffered. If the test is failed, the hit wounds automatically and no armour save is allowed. If the test is passed, roll to wound and take armour saves as normal

Weapon.Name: Dragon Bow
Weapon.Rule: The Dragon Bow has a range of 36" and Strength 6. Any hits from this bow count as being from a magical weapon

Weapon.Name: Sword of Justice
Weapon.Description: The bearer can re-roll failed rolls to wound

Weapon.Name: Wyrmslayer Sword
Weapon.Description: Hits from this sword wound any opponent on a roll of 4+ (unless the wielder's Strength would make this less). Armour saves apply as normal, modified by the Strength of the character, but large targets lose their armour save due to the scaly skin special rule against hits from this sword

Armour.Name: The Gilded Armour
Armour.Description: Heavy armour. Models attacking the wearer in close combat must pass a Strength test before rolling to hit for every Attack directed at the target. If the test is failed, the Attack is lost. Special Attacks (like those of a Giant, impact hits and anything not included in the Attacks value on a model's profile) are not affected

Armour.Name: Dawn Armour
Armour.Description: Full plate armour (armour save 4+). The model can re-roll any failed armour save

Armour.Name: Armour of Tarnus
Armour.Description: Light armour. The Armour of Tarnus confers a 5+ ward save to the wearer

Armour.Name: Armour of Meteoric Iron
Armour.Description: This armour gives the bearer a 1+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means

Additional.Name: Helm of the Ratslayer
Additional.Rule: Causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army
Additional.Description: This helm confers a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally (including normal armour and a shield). In addition, the wearer causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army

Shield.Name: Shield of the Gorgon
Shield.Rule: Can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack
Shield.Description: Shield. The wearer can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack. In the case of models with different Attacks (eg, mounted models) the wearer chooses which Attack is lost. Special Attacks (like those of a Giant, impact hits and anything not included in the Attacks value on a model's profile) are not affected

Shield.Name: Bronze Shield
Shield.Rule: Ignores the first hit in the battle from shooting or close combat
Shield.Description: Shield. The bearer ignores the first hit in the battle from shooting or close combat

Additional.Name: Shroud of Magnus
Additional.Description: This item gives the bearer a 5+ Ward save and magic resistance (2)

Additional.Name: Holy Relic
Additional.Description: The Holy Relic gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save

Additional.Name: Jade Amulet
Additional.Description: The model may ignore the first wound it suffers

Additional.Name: The White Cloak
Additional.Description: This item gives a 5+ ward save, which is increased to 2+ against Flaming Attacks

Additional.Name: The Crimson Amulet
Additional.Rule: Automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests)
Additional.Description: This item gives a 6+ ward save. The wearer automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests)

Additional.Name: Sigil of Sigmar
Additional.Description: The Sigil of Sigmar confers magic resistance (1)

Arcane.Name: Seal of Destruction
Arcane.Rule: Once automatically dispel an enemy spell, on a 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it
Arcane.Description: One use only. The seal has the same effect as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, roll a D6. On a result of 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it. Spells cast from a bound item will only be removed on the result of a 6

Arcane.Name: Grey Wand
Arcane.Description: Gives +1 to the casting attempts made by the Wizard

Arcane.Name: Rod of Power
Arcane.Rule: Can save up to three unused power/dispel dice from the pool and store them, at the beginning of each successive magic phase roll a dice, if the result is equal or higher to the number of dice stored, add them to the power/dispel dice pool
Arcane.Description: At the end of each magic phase (yours and enemy's), you can save up to three unused power/dispel dice from the pool and store them in the rod. At the beginning of each successive magic phase (yours and enemy's), roll a dice. If the result is equal or higher to the number of dice stored, add them to the power/dispel dice pool, if the result is lower than the number of dice stored, they are lost

Arcane.Name: Luckstone
Arcane.Rule: Once per battle, can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel
Arcane.Description: One use only. Once per battle, the bearer can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel a spell. This can effectively cancel a miscast result, and cause irresistible force or a miscast

Arcane.Name: Crystal Ball
Arcane.Rule: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units that are within 24" of the Wizard at any time
Arcane.Description: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units that are within 24" of the Wizard at any time. This includes which magic items are in the unit and who is carrying them, the presence of disguised, hidden or otherwise 'invisible' models and everything else that the player is not normally obliged to disclose to his opponent

Arcane.Name: Wizard's Staff
Arcane.Rule: Use one more dice than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell
Arcane.Description: The Wizard's Staff allows the bearer to use one more dice than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell (eg, a Wizard that can normally use up to two dice to cast spells will be able to use up to three dice)

Additional.Name: Laurels of Victory
Additional.Rule: Each wound caused by a model wearing the Laurels of Victory will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution
Additional.Description: Each wound caused by a model wearing the Laurels of Victory (but not those caused by his mount) will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution. Note that you do not actually cause double wounds on your victim!

Additional.Name: Rod of Command
Additional.Rule: Once per battle, instead rolling the dice for Break test, the player can declare he is using Rod of Command and the character (and his unit) automatically passing Break test
Additional.Description: One use only. Whenever the character (and the unit he is with) have to take a Break test, instead of rolling the dice, the player can declare he is using this item. If the player decides to do so, the character (and his unit) automatically roll double Is (Insane Courage!) for the test, automatically passing it regardless of modifiers. This item cannot be used by a character in a turn he refused a challenge or if he is hiding at the back of the unit (nobody would pay heed to such a coward!)

Additional.Name: Aldred's Casket of Sorcery
Additional.Rule: Bound spell, power level variable: at the end of each of his movement phases, the bearer may remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard within 12" of him on a roll of 4+, the bearer can then cast the captured spell in any of his own following magic phases
Additional.Description: Bound spell, power level variable. At the end of each of his movement phases, the bearer may remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard within 12" of him on a roll of 4+. The bearer can then cast the captured spell in any of his own following magic phases by releasing it from the casket just like from a bound item, whereupon the spell is then removed from the game. Any number of spells may be captured by the casket, and the bearer can cast each one once, either over several magic phases or all at the same time if he prefers. The power level of the spell cast by the casket will be equivalent to the normal casting value of the spell

Additional.Name: The Silver Horn
Additional.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 5, if successfully cast, all fleeing friendly units on the battlefield will rally immediately, regardless of the number of models left
Additional.Description: Bound spell, power level 5. If successfully cast, all fleeing friendly units on the battlefield will rally immediately, regardless of the number of models left

Additional.Name: The Orb of Thunder
Additional.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 4, when the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, flying creatures on the battlefield cannot fly and must move on the ground at their normal Movement rate, remains in play
Additional.Description: Bound spell, power level 4. Remains in play. When the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, flying creatures on the battlefield cannot fly and must move on the ground at their normal Movement rate

Additional.Name: Doomfire Ring
Additional.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3, casts the Burning Head spell from the Lore of Fire
Additional.Description: Bound Spell: Power Level 3. The Doomfire Ring casts the Burning Head spell from the Lore of Fire

Additional.Name: Van Horstmann's Speculum
Additional.Rule: When the wearer fights a challenge he can 'swap' his base Weapon Skill, Strength, Toughness, Initiative and Attacks values with those of his enemy
Additional.Description: When the wearer fights a challenge he can 'swap' his base Weapon Skill, Strength, Toughness, Initiative and Attacks values with those of his enemy. He can choose not to use the mirror, but if he does he must swap all these characteristics for the duration of the challenge. So, the wearer fights with his enemy's WS, S, T, I and A whilst his enemy fights with the wearer's WS, S, T, I and A

Additional.Name: Icon of Magnus
Additional.Rule: The character and the unit he is with are immune to Fear; when faced with an enemy that causes Terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer Fear, not Terror
Additional.Description: The character and the unit he is with are immune to Fear. When faced with an enemy that causes Terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer Fear, not Terror

Additional.Name: Ring of Volans
Additional.Rule: Bound spell: power level variable, one use only: choose any one of the eight magic lores in the Warhammer rulebook and randomly select one spell from that lore to be bound within the Ring of Volans
Additional.Description: One use only. Bound Spell: Power Level variable. Choose any one of the eight magic lores in the Warhammer rulebook and randomly select one spell from that lore to be bound within the Ring of Volans. The power level of the spell cast by the ring will be equivalent to the normal casting value of the spell

Banner.Name: Imperial Banner
Banner.Rule: All units within 12" can re-roll any failed Terror, Fear, Panic or Rally test as well as tests to avoid pursuing a fleeing enemy
Banner.Description: All units with at least one model within 12" of the Imperial Banner can re-roll any failed Terror, Fear, Panic or Rally test as well as tests to avoid pursuing a fleeing enemy

Banner.Name: Banner of Sigismund
Banner.Description: The standard bearer and all models in his unit are Stubborn. Note that this bonus is also conferred to other characters within the unit

Banner.Name: Griffon Standard
Banner.Rule: A unit counts double its rank bonus when it comes to working out combat results
Banner.Description: A unit joined by a Battle Standard Bearer carrying the Griffon Standard counts double its rank bonus when it comes to working out combat results. If the unit is in two ranks it receives +2, in three ranks +4, and in four ranks (the maximum bonus) +6. The unit will never pursue a fleeing enemy, but will always hold its ground, even if affected by a special rule that means it must normally do so

Banner.Name: Banner of the Daemonslayer
Banner.Description: During the turn when it charges into combat, the unit causes Fear (from the moment it is found to be in charge range to the end of that turn)

Banner.Name: Banner of Valour
Banner.Description: The unit is Immune to Panic

Banner.Name: Standard of Arcane Warding
Banner.Description: This banner confers Magic Resistance (2) on the unit that carries it

Banner.Name: Steel Standard
Banner.Rule: The unit can add D3" to its charge move. If the charge is failed, the unit will move forward 7" as normal

Banner.Name: Banner of Duty
Banner.Rule: The unit can re-roll any failed Rally test

SpecialRules.Original: Knows all six spell from Lore of metal list

RangeWeapon.Name: Al-kahest
RangeWeapon.Rule: Attack with range of 6", wounding any target on a 4+, no armour save

Armour.Name: The Cloak of Molten Metal
Armour.Rule: 3+ ward save against any missle attack
